okx-wasmy.createCwNotebook.title: Create a new CW Notebook
The Okx Wasmy sidebar commands will work while in untrusted workspaces. However, cannot run tests or upload contract binaries when in untrusted workspaces. Additionally, JSON auto complete might also not work.
okxwasmy.chainConfigName.desc: Used to select which of the Chain configs in `#okxwasmy.chains#` is to be used in this workspace
okxwasmy.chainConfigName.deprecationDesc: This property is not used anymore in fetching the workspace chain config. Click on the Status bar item to select the chain config you require.
okxwasmy.chains.items.title: Chain Info
okxwasmy.chains.items.configName.desc: User friendly name for the saved network config. Use as input to `okxwasmy.chainConfigName` to select this config to be used in the workspace.
okxwasmy.chains.items.chainEnvironment.d: Is the chain localnet, testnet or (god forbid üò®) mainnet
okxwasmy.chains.items.chainEnvironment.l: The chain is running locally on your system
okxwasmy.chains.items.chainEnvironment.t: The chain is a testnet chain
okxwasmy.chains.items.chainEnvironment.m: The chain is mainnet. DO NOT CONNECT MAINNETS to the extension unless you are super sure you know what you are doing. The extension saves the seed phrase in plain text.
okxwasmy.chains.items.rpcEndpoint.desc: RPC address and port where the chain RPC server listens on
okxwasmy.chains.items.defaultGasPrice.de: Default amount of gas to be used as the gas limit for a transaction
okxwasmy.chains.items.chainDenom.desc: The micro denom used to track account balance. If chainGasDenom is not provided, this value is used as gas denom
okxwasmy.chains.items.chainGasDenom.desc: The micro denom used to pay for gas. If this value is not provided, the `chainDenom` value is used
okxwasmy.chains.items.chainDenomDecimals: Default decimals to display account balance
okxwasmy.chains.items.signType.desc: The signature algorithm when signing transactions, `ethsecp256k1` or `tmsecp256k1`, default `tmsecp256k1`
okxwasmy.chains.items.faucetEndpoint.des: Faucet address and port to request funds
okxwasmy.chains.items.accountExplorerLin: Block explorer url which includes '${accountAddress}' text to generate account url
okxwasmy.chains.items.txExplorerLink.des: Block explorer url which includes '${txHash}' text to generate tx url
okxwasmy.contractSortOrder.desc: Controls the sorting order of the Smart Contracts in the Contract view
Sort the Smart Contracts alphabetically by their label
okxwasmy.contractSortOrder.codeId.desc: Sort the Smart Contracts by the Code ID
okxwasmy.contractSortOrder.none.desc: No explicit sorting - Maintains the order the contracts were imported in
okxwasmy.cosmwasmResponseView.desc: Controls where the smart contract interactions should be displayed
okxwasmy.cosmwasmResponseView.newFile.de: Open a new dummy doc with response
okxwasmy.cosmwasmResponseView.terminal.d: A seperate output channel by Okx Wasmy in the Output view
okxwasmy.maxHistoryStored.desc: Controls the latest number of queries and txs kept in history for easy re-execution. If set to `0` the feature is disabled and nothing is stored
okxwasmy.openTxExplorerInVscode.desc: If this setting is set, and the current chain config has `txExplorerLink` value set, on the successful execution of a msg, the tx explorer link opens automatically within vscode in simple browser
beaker.autosync.desc: If this setting is set, any accounts configured in [Beaker.toml](https://github.com/osmosis-labs/beaker/blob/main/docs/config/README.md) will be automatically loaded into Okx Wasmy
okxwasmy.viewsWelcome.account.desc:
‚ö†Ô∏è Looks like there are no accounts set up. 
 [Add an account](command:okx-wasmy.addAccount)
okxwasmy.viewsWelcome.contract.desc:
‚ö†Ô∏è Looks like there are no imported contracts. 
 [Import a contract](command:okx-wasmy.addContract)
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.title: Getting Started with Okx Wasmy
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.description: Discover how to use Okx Wasmy and what all it offers
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.primary.openCWView: Click on the Okx Wasmy logo in the Activity Bar/sidebar to open the extension
Create a new key. You can import an existing seed phrase or generate a new one. 
[Add Account](command:okx-wasmy.addAccount)
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.primary.changeChai:
Change the chain the current workspace is connected to. You can select the chain in the status bar below.
The chains are organized by localnet, testnet, mainnet and Beaker imported chain configs. 
[Change Chain Config](command:okx-wasmy.reloadConfig)
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.primary.importCont:
Import a contract which have already been deployed by their bech32 address. 
[Import Contract](command:okx-wasmy.addContract)
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.primary.executeCon:
Select a contract from the Contract view and an account from the Account view as currently active contract and account and input your execute json and click on ``Execute`` button to execute the contract tx.
You can also pass in funds if your contract requires any.
The response from the contract is shown in the Output channel and you can see the txHash in the notification.
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.primary.simulateCo: Right click on a wasm binary to get the option to simulate the binary in the Cosmwasm VM within vscode
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.accounts.title: Okx Wasmy: Accounts
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.accounts.descripti: Discover how to use Accounts in Okx Wasmy and what all it offers
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.accounts.addNew.de:
Create a new key. You can import an existing seed phrase or generate a new one. 
[Add Account](command:okx-wasmy.addAccount)
‚ùóEnsure you are not using your mainnet seed phrases. The seed phrase is stored in plain text by vscode
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.accounts.copyAddre: Right click on an account to get the option to copy the account address into your $(clippy) clipboard
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.accounts.copyMnemo: Right click on an account to get the option to copy the account seed phrase into your $(clippy) clipboard
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.accounts.requestFu: If a faucet has been configured in the chain config, you will see the ``Request Funds`` icon next to the account. You can click on the button to request funds from the faucet
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.accounts.deleteAcc:
Right click on an account to get the option to delete the account from the extension. 
‚ùóAccount is only removed from the Okx Wasmy vscode extension. The account and its state continues to persist on chain.
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.accounts.refresh.d:
Click on the $(refresh) Refresh icon to refresh all the account balances. 
[Refresh Accounts](command:okx-wasmy.refreshAccount)
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.contracts.title: Okx Wasmy: Contracts
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.contracts.descript: Discover how to use Contracts in Okx Wasmy and what all it offers
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.contracts.import.d:
Import a contract which have already been deployed by its bech32 address. 
[Import Contract](command:okx-wasmy.addContract)
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.contracts.notes.de: You can add personal notes and comments $(comment) to contracts. This information is only stored by the extension and is not stored on chain
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.contracts.copyAddr: Right click on a contract to get the option to copy the address into your $(clippy) clipboard
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.contracts.checksum: If you would like to verify the checksum of any contract, you can right click on the contract to get the option to Display Checksum
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.contracts.binary.d: Right click on the contract in the Contract view to view the option to Download the contract binary. This will fetch the contract from the chain and store it locally at the root of your repository.
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.contracts.adminCha: Right click on the contract to get the option to update the current contract admin or clear the contarct admin. You can only do this with the current contract admin account
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.contracts.deleteCo:
Right click on an account to get the option to delete the contract from the extension. 
‚ùóContract is only removed from the Okx Wasmy vscode extension. The contract and its state continues to persist on chain.
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.contracts.upload.d: Select an account from the Account view to use to upload the contract. Click on the $(cloud-upload) upload contract icon or right click on a wasm binary file and click on ``Upload Contract`` menu item to upload the contract to the selected chain.
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.notebooks.title: Okx Wasmy: CW Notebooks
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.notebooks.descript: Discover how to use CW Notebooks in Okx Wasmy
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.notebooks.new.titl: Create or open a CW Notebook
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.notebooks.new.desc:
Right click in the file explorer and create a new file with an ``.cwnotebook`` extension. Or, open the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands) and run the command 

[Create New CW Notebook](command:okx-wasmy.createCwNotebook)
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.notebooks.setup.de: You can setup which wasm binary and schema is used by the Cosmwasm VM in a TOML code block
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.notebooks.run.desc: You can run the json blocks in the CW Notebook to execute against a Cosmwasm VM. You can instantiate contracts and query and execute messages
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.cosmwasm.title: Okx Wasmy: Cosmwasm Interactions
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.cosmwasm.descripti: Discover how to interact with Cosmwasm Contracts in Okx Wasmy
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.cosmwasm.initializ: Once a contract has been uploaded you can initialize it using the sidebar. You need to select an account in the Account view which will be used to initialize the contract. You need to provide the Code Id and input message and optionally, any funds you might wanna send to the contract
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.cosmwasm.query.des: Click on any contract in the Contract view and pass in input json in the Query view to run the given query against the selected contract
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.cosmwasm.execute.d:
Select a contract from the Contract view and an account from the Account view as currently active contract and account and input your execute json and click on ``Execute`` button to execute the contract tx.
You can also pass in funds if your contract requires any.
The response from the contract is shown in the Output channel and you can see the txHash in the notification.
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.cosmwasm.autocompl:
Once your project has been loaded, run ``cargo schema`` to generate the json schema for the contract. Now open any new JSON file and you can get the json input auto complete for your contract. 
You can click on the top right button on the JSON page to execute or query the smart contract right from the file
okxwasmy.walkthroughs.cosmwasm.history.d:
Based on the configured settings, you can choose to store your latest cosmwasm interactions like query and execute.
Click in the $(history) on the ``Query`` or ``Execute`` view to load the history. The inputs of the interaction are stored and the historical interaction can be re-run from the History view
